title: epi2me-labs/wf-somatic-variation
description: Nextflow workflow to identify somatic variation.

workflow.title: Workflow Options
workflow.description: Select which sub-workflows of wf-human-variation you wish to run. Parameters for each sub-workflow can be changed using the sections below.

snv.title: SNV: Short variants
snv.help_text: If this option is selected, small variant calling will be carried out using ClairS.

sv.title: SV: Structural variants
sv.help_text: If this option is selected, the workflow will call somatic structural variants using nanomonsv.

mod.title: MOD: Differential modifications
mod.description: Enable output of differentially modified sites and differentially modified regions [requires input BAMs with ML and MM tags].
mod.help_text: If this option is selected, modified bases will be aggregated with modkit and differential modifications will be computed with DSS.

input.title: Main options
input.description: Primary options for the data analysis.

sample_name.title: Sample name
sample_name.description: Sample name to be displayed in workflow outputs.
sample_name.help_text: The sample name will be used from the workflow to correctly name output files.

bam_normal.title: Normal BAM
bam_normal.description: Path to a BAM (or CRAM) containing aligned or unaligned reads for the normal sample.
bam_normal.help_text: You may choose to provide a BAM/CRAM, but not both.

bam_tumor.title: Tumor BAM
bam_tumor.description: Path to a BAM (or CRAM) containing aligned or unaligned reads for the tumor sample.
bam_tumor.help_text: You may choose to provide a BAM/CRAM, but not both.

ref.title: Reference genome file
ref.description: Path to a reference FASTA file.
ref.help_text: Reference against which to compare reads for variant calling.

bed.title: Target region BED file
bed.description: An optional BED file enumerating regions to process for variant calling.

tr_bed.title: Tandem repeat BED file
tr_bed.description: An optional BED file enumerating simple repeat regions.
tr_bed.help_text: This command provides a bed file specifying the location of the simple repetitive elements in the genome of choice. This file should be a standard bed file, as described in the [UCSC specification](https://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat.html#format1).

out_dir.title: Output directory
out_dir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.

annotation.help_text: If this option is deselected, VCFs will not be annotated with [SnpEff](https://pcingola.github.io/SnpEff/).

qc_options.title: Quality Control Options
qc_options.description: Parameters that relate to the quality control of the reads.

depth_intervals.title: Depth intervals
depth_intervals.description: Output a bedGraph file with entries for each genomic interval featuring homogeneous depth.
depth_intervals.help_text: The output [bedGraph](https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/bedgraph.html) file will have an entry for each genomic interval in which all positions have the same alignment depth. By default this workflow outputs summary depth information from your aligned reads. Per-base depth outputs are slower to generate but may be required for some downstream applications.

depth_window_size.help_text: This options specify the window size to use when computing the coverage along the genome.

tumor_min_coverage.title: Tumor minimum coverage
tumor_min_coverage.description: Minimum read coverage for the tumor sample required to run analysis.
tumor_min_coverage.help_text: Tumor bam below this coverage value will fail the coverage threshold, and will not be processed in downstream analyses.

normal_min_coverage.title: Normal minimum coverage
normal_min_coverage.description: Minimum read coverage for the normal sample required to run analysis.
normal_min_coverage.help_text: Normal bam below this coverage value will fail the coverage threshold, and will not be processed in downstream analyses.

snv_options.title: Small variant calling options
snv_options.description: Options specific to the small variant calling subworkflow.

basecaller_cfg.title: Basecaller configuration
basecaller_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for converting signal and selecting a small variant calling model.
basecaller_cfg.help_text: Required for basecalling and small variant calling. The basecaller configuration is used to automatically select the appropriate small variant calling model. Refer to the [model table on the Dorado repository for selecting a simplex basecalling model](https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado#available-basecalling-models).

ctg_name.description: The name of the sequence to be processed.

hybrid_mode_vcf.description: Enable hybrid calling mode that combines the *de novo* calling results and genotyping results at the positions in the VCF file given.

genotyping_mode_vcf.description: VCF file input containing candidate sites to be genotyped. Variants will only be called at the sites in the VCF file if provided.

normal_vcf.title: Pre-computed normal VCF
normal_vcf.description: VCF file input containing normal sites for the given sample.
normal_vcf.help_text: Pointing to a pre-computed normal VCF file will prevent the workflow from calling the germline sites for the normal sample, reducing processing time.

include_all_ctgs.title: Include all contigs
include_all_ctgs.description: Call for variants on all sequences in the reference, otherwise small variants will only be called on chr{1..22,X,Y}.
include_all_ctgs.help_text: Enabling this option will call for variants on all contigs of the input reference sequence. Typically this option is not required as standard human reference sequences contain decoy and unplaced contigs that are usually omitted for the purpose of variant calling. This option might be useful for non-standard reference sequence databases.

skip_haplotype_filter.title: Skip haplotype filtering
skip_haplotype_filter.help_text: Setting this will skip haplotype filtering of variants.

fast_mode.title: Fast mode
fast_mode.description: Fast germline variants calling in Clair3 (does not emit germline calls).
fast_mode.help_text: Setting this will speed up the germline calling from Clair3 by relaxing the variant calling parameters; this matches ClairS default behaviour, and therefore will not emit germline VCFs.

snv_min_af.description: Minimum SNP AF required for a candidate variant.

min_contig_size.description: Contigs with contig size < min_contig_size are filtered.

min_qual.description: Variants with QUAL < min_qual are soft filtered.

min_cov.description: Minimum coverage required to call somatic variants.

indel_min_af.description: Minimum somatic indel allelic frequency (if the model is r9, this will be automatically set to 1.00).

clair3_min_mq.description: Minimum map quality to call germline variants.

clair3_ref_pct_full.description: Expected percentage of low quality 0/0 variants called in the pileup mode for full-alignment mode calling.

clair3_var_pct_full.description: Expected percentage of low quality 0/1 and 1/1 variants called in the pileup mode for full-alignment mode calling.

germline.title: Call germline sites
germline.description: The workflow will perform germline calling and tumor phasing as default; set to false to disable this (greatly speeds up execution).

phase_normal.title: Phase normal sample
phase_normal.description: Phase and tag the normal, in addition to the tumor dataset.

clair3_phase_vcf.description: Enable to output phasing information in the output VCF.
clair3_phase_vcf.help_text: By default the final VCF output by the workflow is not phased, although some intermediates are approximately phased.

print_germline_calls.description: Save germline calls in the VCF file.

print_ref_calls.description: Save the homozygote reference calls in the VCF file.

use_longphase_intermediate.description: Use longphase in intermediate phasing steps.

vcf_fn.description: Candidate sites VCF file input, variants will only be called at the sites in the VCF file if provided.

sv_calling.title: Somatic structural variant calling options
sv_calling.description: Parameters for tweaking the run of the SV module.

min_sv_length.title: Minimum SV size
min_sv_length.help_text: Provide the minimum size of the structural variants to call with nanomonsv.

classify_insert.title: Classify insertion sequence
classify_insert.help_text: Run nanomonsv insert_classify to annotate transposable and repetitive elements for the inserted SV sequences.

qv.title: Quality value
qv.description: Approximate single base quality value (QV), one of 10, 15, 20 or 25.
qv.help_text: Expected single base quality as described in the [nanomonsv web page](https://github.com/friend1ws/nanomonsv#get).

mod_options.title: Methylation calling options
mod_options.description: Options specific to the methyl calling subworkflow.

force_strand.title: Force strand
force_strand.description: Require modkit to call strand-aware modifications.
force_strand.help_test: By default strand calls are collapsed (strand reported as '.'). Enabling this will force stranding to be considered when calling modifications, creating one output per modification per strand and the report will be tabulated by both modification and strand.

modkit_args.title: Modkit additional arguments
modkit_args.help_text: This is an advanced option to allow running modkit with custom settings. The arguments specified in this option will fully override all options set by the workflow. . To provide custom arguments to `modkit` from command line proceed as follow: `--modkit_args="--preset traditional"`

multiprocessing_options.title: Multiprocessing Options
multiprocessing_options.description: Options for configuring the common processes across the different subworkflows.
multiprocessing_options.help_text: These options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

ubam_map_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for aligning reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus).

ubam_sort_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for sorting and indexing aligned reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus).

ubam_bam2fq_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for uncompressing uBAM and generating FASTQ for alignment (limited by config executor cpus).

annotation_threads.description: Total number of threads to use in SnpEff annotation (limited by config executor cpus).

nanomonsv_get_threads.description: Total number of threads to use in `nanomonsv get` (minimum of 2 and limited by config executor cpus).

dss_threads.description: Total number of threads to use in the DSS differential modification analysis (limited by config executor cpus).
dss_threads.help_test: The DSS R Package step identifies differentially modified loci and regions, a computationally intensive step. Increasing this parameter speeds up the analysis, at the cost of increased memory requirements.

modkit_threads.description: Total number of threads to use in modkit modified base calling (limited by config executor cpus).

haplotype_filter_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for the haplotype filtering stage in SNV workflow (limited by config executor cpus).

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Advanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.
advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

GVCF.description: Enable to output a gVCF file in addition to the VCF outputs (experimental).
GVCF.help_text: By default the the workflow outputs a VCF file containing only records where a variant has been detected. Enabling this option will output additionally a gVCF with records spanning all reference positions regardless of whether a variant was detected in the sample.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

resources.run_time: Variable depending on sequencing modality (targeted sequencing or whole genome sequencing), as well as coverage and the individual analyses requested. For instance, a 60X/30X Tumor/Normal pair takes approximately 17h:30m on a 64 core machine with 256Gb of memory.
